intro: Hieracium paraguayense subsp. ventanicum, commonly known as the Paraguayan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has hairy stems and basal leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
